Token.Abstract: The C4ScrollView class provides support for displaying content that is larger than the size of the application’s window. It enables users to scroll within that content by making swiping gestures, and to zoom in and back from portions of the content by making pinching gestures.
Creates and returns a new scrollview sized to the specified frame.

Parameter.Name: rect
Parameter.Abstract: the frame used to create the size and position of the scrollview.

Token.Abstract: The UIScrollview object that is the primary subview of the receiver.
The UIScrollview object that is the primary subview of the receiver.
The UIScrollview object that is the primary subview of the receiver.
The delegate object for the receiver.

The delegate object for the receiver.
Sets the offset from the content view’s origin that corresponds to the receiver’s origin.

Parameter.Name: contentOffset
Parameter.Abstract: A point (expressed in points) that is offset from the content view’s origin.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: YES to animate the transition at a constant velocity to the new offset, NO to make the transition immediate.

Token.Abstract: The point at which the origin of the content view is offset from the origin of the scroll view.
The point at which the origin of the content view is offset from the origin of the scroll view.
The point at which the origin of the content view is offset from the origin of the scroll view.

A Boolean value that controls whether the scroll-to-top gesture is effective

Scrolls a specific area of the content so that it is visible in the receiver.

Parameter.Name: rect
Parameter.Abstract: A rectangle defining an area of the content view.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: YES if the scrolling should be animated, NO if it should be immediate.

Token.Abstract: A Boolean value that determines whether paging is enabled for the scroll view.

A Boolean value that controls whether touches in the content view always lead to tracking.

Zooms to a specific area of the content so that it is visible in the receiver.

Parameter.Name: rect
Parameter.Abstract: A rectangle defining an area of the content view.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: YES if the scrolling should be animated, NO if it should be immediate.

Token.Abstract: A floating-point value that specifies the current scale factor applied to the scroll view's content.
A floating-point value that specifies the current scale factor applied to the scroll view's content.
A floating-point value that specifies the current scale factor applied to the scroll view's content.
A floating-point value that specifies the current zoom scale.

Parameter.Name: scale
Parameter.Abstract: The new value to scale the content to.

Parameter.Name: animated
Parameter.Abstract: YES to animate the transition to the new scale, NO to make the transition immediate.

Token.Abstract: A floating-point value that specifies the maximum scale factor that can be applied to the scroll view's content.
A floating-point value that specifies the maximum scale factor that can be applied to the scroll view's content.

A Boolean value that indicates that zooming has exceeded the scaling limits specified for the receiver. (read-only)
A Boolean value that indicates that zooming has exceeded the scaling limits specified for the receiver. (read-only)
A Boolean value that indicates whether the content view is currently zooming in or out. (read-only)
A Boolean value that indicates whether the content view is currently zooming in or out. (read-only)
A Boolean value that indicates whether the content view is currently zooming in or out. (read-only)
A Boolean value that determines whether the scroll view animates the content scaling when the scaling exceeds the maximum or minimum limits.
A Boolean value that determines whether the scroll view animates the content scaling when the scaling exceeds the maximum or minimum limits.

Overridden by subclasses to customize the default behavior when a finger touches down in displayed content.

Parameter.Name: touches
Parameter.Abstract: A set of UITouch instances that represent the touches for the starting phase of the event represented by event.

Parameter.Name: event
Parameter.Abstract: An object representing the event to which the touch objects in touches belong.

Parameter.Name: view
Parameter.Abstract: The subview in the content where the touch-down gesture occurred.

ReturnValue.Abstract: value NO if you don’t want the scroll view to send event messages to view. If you want view to receive those messages, return YES (the default).

Token.Abstract: Returns whether to cancel touches related to the content subview and start dragging.

Parameter.Name: view
Parameter.Abstract: The view object in the content that is being touched.

ReturnValue.Abstract: value YES to cancel further touch messages to view, NO to have view continue to receive those messages. The default returned value is YES if view is not a UIControl object; otherwise, it returns NO.

Token.Abstract: Returns the appearance proxy for the object, cast as a C4ScrollView rather than the standard (id) cast provided by UIAppearance.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The appearance proxy for the receiver, cast as a C4ScrollView.
